attributes.title: Declare Completion with Brahman, the Consciousness
attributes.description:
"Paramahamsa Nithyananda enters into the next part of the Shanti Mantra of Kena Upanishad, revealing the deeper layers of the science of Declaration or Will by the Upanishads on 4th July 2016, Nithya Satsang, from Varanasi. Only a person whose 'inner image', i.e. the idea you carry about you, is integrated and authentic to the know the Sacred Truths, Dharma can declare and create a will that – May the Dharma, may Sadashiva manifest in me, for I am devoted to knowing and experiencing Him. Sadashiva has revealed atleast 200 techniques of Completion. The science of WILL is the highest form of Completion. 
Shanti Mantra Revealed    
mā mā brahma nirākarod-anirākaraṇamstva-nirākaraṇam me’stu |
tadātmani nirate ya upaniṣatsu dharmāste mayi santu te mayi santu ||
auṁ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ ||
""May Brahman never deny me or withdraw Its grace from me. Let there be no separation. Let me have Completion with Brahman, the Consciousness; and let Brahman be complete with me. So be it.
May all Dharma, the Sacred Truths declared by Upaniṣads be fully manifest and radiate in me, who, am integrated and authentically devoted to knowing and experiencing of that Truth, Ātma, the Self. May they manifest and radiate in me.""

His Holiness also gives the jewels of Yoga, the original Vedic sciences. Hinduism or Vedic tradition and Yoga are inseparable. The moment one practices even Surya Namaskar, one becomes a practicing Hindu. For a true Yoga seeker, the original Sanskrit scriptures become the Source language to learn the pure Vedic Yogic sciences and Truths. By thinking in Sanskrit, the language or vibrations of Divine, one becomes enlightened."
